data.title: Interesting local spot
data.text: I didn't expect such a nice local place. The service was very good,the tea served with a tea kettle filed with extra te,something that isn't always done,the miso soup was not too salty but was simple. One of the rolls was very good but another just so so.  I didn't like the pad Thai at all

data.title: Great sashimi
data.text: Fresh fish and the yellowtail jaw was grilled to perfection. I just wish the dipping sauce could have a little more flavor to it. My first time here and saw great reviews online. I'll be going back to try other dishes.

data.title: Hamachi Thai And Sushi - Love It!!!!
data.text: Go there almost every week.  Food is always great. - You have to try their "Yummy Tuna" - it's incredible !

data.title: Great sushi, lots of variety
data.text: Really enjoyed the sushi here. Great variety on the menu. Service a bit slow, but we were taking our time. Would recommend!

data.title: World Class Sushi!
data.text: I eat sushi all over the USA.  Hamachi Thai and Sushi is on my top 10 list for offering the BEST!  Creative rolls that are it only fresh but balanced. We can't wait to return. Cheers!!

data.title: SO MANY CHOICES!!
data.text: A nice variety of items other than sushi, but we came for the sushi.  We had quite the task to decide which rolls we would order as the all sounded AMAZING!  The sushi came out and was innovative, so fresh and delicious. We can't wait to go back over and over until we've tried it all!!!!

data.title: Our go to sushi restaurant!
data.text:
I have been dining at Hamachi for roughly 3 years now and can truthfully say I have never had a bad meal. I have ordered every Roll at least once and fine them all to be fantastic in a multitude of ways. If you are looking for sushi, this is the place to go.
If you are more in the mood for thai you have also come to the right place. From there excellent pad thai, to there delicious curry you won't be disappointed.
Staff are very friendly and helpful with recommendations for anyone. If you are looking for one of the best restaurants in coral springs, you have to try Hamachi.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Enjoyed the conch and octopus spicy salad and the Pad Thai is awesome as well as the Tom Kha soup.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Freaking awesome
data.text: I been coming weekly for the past two years. This place is one of the best sushi restaurant I ever went, and I almost circle the globe. The service is perfect, since is a family busses. They have some amazing rolls like the lobster bomb that will blow your brains out, as well as the  yummy tuna, spice tom yum soup, scallop bomb, mussel dynamite, I mean all are grate. But if you are in the mood of Tai. Just order the crispy duck basil and you nay remember this place for life.

data.title: Best Sushi in South Florida
data.text:
Want the best sushi in all of Florida? This is the place.
Want the best service? This is the place.
My whole household loves the flavor of everything there.
A must try and you'll understand why I took the time to post this review.

data.title: Simple Restaurant with exceptional food and service
data.text:
This restaurant is simple in its look outside and inside. Nothing to catch your eyes, but you have to enter to appreciate what can offer. Attentive staff, simple décor, and good food and reasonable price. I was introduced to this place by my own daughters who discovered the place.
I wish the décor is not in predominantly dark color theme as it makes the place darker and the space is already small.
The staff will accommodate some variations in your order if it can be done like: bigger serving of the  salad instead of soup/salad combo. They will take away an ingredient if it does not suit you. I usually order their clear noodles with choice of meat and vegetables( Pad woo sen) but without the egg, will substitute with more vegetables.
The food presentation is nicely done even just for lunch.
The sushi are made fresh. You will taste the  appropriate temp of the food whether it's supposed to come warm or cold.
The prices are reasonable and servings are adequate.
I tend to order same food when I go to other Thai/Sushi places so I can gauge who makes it more to my liking. They do it better than those in the other same size or bigger restaurants in the area. 
If they make the place more colorful in their décor outside/ inside and airy looking, they offer the best of both worlds. Good food and reasonably priced and a quiet ambience to eat with a smaller group.
I take my daughters and my co workers there usually during lunch hours at least 1-2 times a month.

data.title: Always Exceptionally Good
data.text: This restaurant is one of Coral Springs best kept secret. We enjoy their service and food each time we visit. Both the sushi and Thai food are very good. Their prices are very reasonable as well.

data.title: Sushi with fantasy
data.text: Nice sushi, very tastie, big variety and spicy Rolls, my favorite. I also liked the tom yum soup with plenty of fresh shrimps. The Service may get better, I will come back however.

data.title: Hamachi Thai and Sushi
data.text: Hamachi Thai is well maintained and has a good staff. I do like Thai but no favor for sushi. I had tea, spring rolls, and a fried chicken rice combo.

data.title: The best small secret sushi place in town
data.text: i have a custom roll and the waitress remembers our orders like we go every week.It was a choice by friends and we all go now...my chef son choice of fresh fish...Tom Kar soup is amazing.. a bit of a wait on weekends but worth it

data.title: nothing really special
data.text: service was very good.  food was just average.  we started off with appetizers of spring rolls and a jalapeño sushi.  both were ok.  complimentary salad (tiny portion of just lettuce with ginger dressing) and an even smaller portion of soup (Miso)) came with the dinner. the entrees of a spicy noodle dish and another of garlic chicken were mediocre. not worthy of a return visit.

data.title: Sushilicious
data.text:
Started taking out from Himachi a couple months ago. Sushi is good, fresh and fair priced. Rolls are slightly thinner but with more pieces than usual. 

Have had their Pad Thai a couple of times as well. Flavor is good but chicken is consistently overly dried out. 

Have not eaten in, but restaurant is busy with eclectic music playing, reminding me of my days in NYC. 

I recommend trying, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: The Best Sushi
data.text: The staff are so helpful. They talk to you by names, which is great. it seems like you know them for long time. The services are the best, and fast. Always full of people... the ambience is perfect for family or couple. I really love this restaurant. My favorite!!

data.title: Doesn't open on time
data.text: They don't care to open on time for customers then they don't deserve customers we waited several minutes for the time open the doors for customers but they where late to open up so we went to good red ginger right down the street instead.

data.title: Amazing experience!!!
data.text:
I was in Coral Springs working and before heading back home to Orlando I found out this place in TripAdvisor. It's very well and centric located in Sample Rd. and was very easy to find and drive from the hospital I was working. As I never visited before I asked the waitress to help me with the selection and wouldn't be better. What a delicious!!! The food is wonderful in this place.
Will be back for sure, the restaurant has a very good ambiance as well.
